Invasion_PGF module¶

Introduction¶

Invasion_PGF is a Python package for applying Probability Generating Functions [PGFs] to invasive processes, with an emphasis on the early spread of infectious disease.

The functions are based on the tutorial

A tutorial on the use of probability generating functions in infectious disease modeling

Please cite the tutorial if using these algorithms.

Functions (click on function name for full documentation)¶

Discrete time functions¶

R0(offspring_PGF[, dx, central_diff]) Approximates R0 based on PGF of offspring distribution
extinction_prob(offspring_PGF, Gen[, ...]) Finds the probability of extinction by generation Gen
active_infections(offspring_PGF, Gen[, M, ...]) Calculates the probability of having 0, 1, ..., M-1 active infections in generation Gen.
completed_infections(offspring_PGF, Gen[, ...]) Gives the probability of 0, 1, ..., M-1 completed infections
active_and_completed(offspring_PGF, Gen[, ...]) Gives probability of having 0, ...., M1-1 active infections and 0,..., M2-1 completed infections at generation Gen.
final_sizes(PGF_function[, M, numpts, radius]) Estimates the probability of each final size from 0 up to M-1 given the offspring PGF.

Continuous-time functions¶

cts_time_R0(beta, gamma) Gives R0 assuming transmission rate beta and recovery rate gamma
cts_time_extinction_prob(beta, gamma[, T, ...]) Gives probability of eventual extinction, extinction by time T, or at times in interval [0,T] for continuous-time model.
cts_time_active_infections(beta, gamma, T[, ...]) Gives probability of having 0, ..., M-1 active infections at time T or at times in interval [0,T] for continuous-time model.
cts_time_completed_infections(beta, gamma, T) Gives probability of having 0, ...., M-1 completed infections at time T.
cts_time_active_and_completed(beta, gamma, T) Gives probability of having 0, ...., M1-1 active infections and 0,..., M2-1 completed infections at time T.
cts_time_final_sizes(beta, gamma[, M]) Calculates the final size distribution of outbreaks.
